interface.name: aerugo_wm_v1
interface.description: The global interface for window management in a compositor.

entry.name: already_constructed
entry.summary: the global has already been constructed for this client

entry.name: dead_wm
entry.summary: a protocol object was used when the wm is finished

entry.name: defunct_objects
entry.summary: a child protocol object was used when the wm is finished

entry.name: unresponsive
entry.summary: the wm did not respond to a ping event in time

entry.name: already_extended
entry.summary: a ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 already has an instance of a aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1

request.name: destroy
request.description:
Destroys the aerugo_wm_v1 object.
When the destructor is invoked, all child objects become inert.

request.name: pong
request.description:
The WM must respond to a ping event with a pong request or the WM may be deemed unresponsive.
See aerugo_wm_v1.ping and aerugo_wm_v1.error.unresponsive for more information.

request.name: get_wm_toplevel
request.description:
Creates the aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1 object for the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 instance.
It is illegal to create more than one aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1 per ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 object. Otherwise a aerugo_wm_v1.error.already_extended error is sent.

event.name: ping
event.description:
The ping event asks if the wm is still alive. The serial in this event must be passed back in the "pong" event in some amount of time to be kept alive.
If the wm is unresponsive, the server may decide when the wm is considered dead and disconnected.
See aerugo_wm_v1.ping and aerugo_wm_v1.error.unresponsive for more information.

interface.name: aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1
interface.description: This interface extends the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 interface, providing functionality to configure the state of a toplevel.

entry.name: defunct_object
entry.summary: the toplevel handle was destroyed before it's aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1 object

request.name: destroy
request.description:
Destroys the aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1 object.
It is illegal to destroy the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 object the aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1 object was created from. Otherwise a aerugo_wm_toplevel_v1.error.defunct_object error is sent.
